revised_title: The Influence of Isolation and Crowding on the Production of Sexual Forms in Cladocera
tldr: The author investigates the effects of isolation and crowding on the production of sexual forms in Cladocera, specifically Daphnia pulex. The study shows that isolation at a high temperature suppresses the production of sexual forms, while crowding at a lower temperature promotes their development. This suggests that an internal factor, rather than external conditions, influences sexual reproduction in these organisms.
